metadata.feature_description: Compare different versions of content with visual diff highlighting

steps.action: Logged in as SuperUser and entered Edit Mode
steps.expected: Edit bar appears at the bottom of the page
steps.actual: Edit bar appeared with Add Module, Settings, History, View Modes buttons and Discard/Publish actions

steps.action: Clicked the Page History button in the Edit Bar
steps.expected: Page History panel opens showing available versions
steps.actual: Page History panel opened showing Version 3 (Draft) and Version 2 (Published) with Compare checkboxes, version numbers, dates, users, and states

steps.action: Selected both Version 3 and Version 2 checkboxes for comparison
steps.expected: Both checkboxes are checked and Compare button becomes enabled
steps.actual: Both checkboxes were checked successfully and the Compare button became enabled (clickable)

steps.expected: Comparison view opens showing both versions side by side with visual diff highlighting
steps.actual: Comparison view opened showing Version 3 and Version 2 in a split-screen view. Visual diff highlighting was displayed with 'Inserted' (green) and 'Deleted' (red/strikethrough) legend. Content differences were clearly marked including additions like '[DRAFT TEST]', 'Token Test:', and various new content blocks

steps.action: Clicked Close button to exit comparison view
steps.expected: Comparison view closes and returns to Page History panel
steps.actual: Comparison view closed successfully and returned to the Page History panel with the version checkboxes still selected

observations: Content Comparison is a page-level feature accessed via Edit Bar > Page History, not a module-level feature
The feature uses HtmlDiff library (HtmlDiff.dll) to compute differences between page versions
Visual diff highlighting uses insertion (green background) and deletion (red/pink background with strikethrough) styling
The comparison view displays two versions in split-screen iframes with synchronized scrolling capability
The comparison works at the page level, comparing all versionable modules on the page simultaneously
Non-versionable modules are handled separately and restored after diff computation
